alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:35PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern El Dorado, northeastern Placer, southwestern Sierra and northeastern Nevada Counties through 615 PM PDT... At 535 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Blue Canyon to 8 miles northeast of Chiquita Lake to Big Bend Summit to White Hall. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sierra City, Baxter, Blue Canyon, Cisco, Big Bend Summit, Emigrant Gap, Sugar Pine, Bowman Lake, Alleghany, White Cloud Campground, Lake Spaulding, Skillman Campground, Rattlesnake Mountain and Graniteville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
